snippet: Urban radio serves a special purpose when the nation is wounded by a crime with hosts like Ebro Darden of Hot 97 turning shows into sounding boards.
abstract: Radio stations across United States catering primarily to black audiences, known as urban radio, are dedicating significant amounts of airtime to discussion of Charleston, SC, killings; radio hosts are taking calls from grieving listeners, allowing them to channel their shock and sorrow and attempting to make sense of tragedy.
lead_paragraph: Urban radio serves a special purpose when the nation is wounded by a crime with hosts like Ebro Darden of Hot 97 turning shows into sounding boards.

headline.main: Radio D.J.s Offer Comfort and Community After Charleston Church Killings
